福克斯新闻周一表示，电视网资深人士杰西·沃特斯将担任因顶级主持人塔克·卡尔森退出而空出的一个重要黄金时段的主持人。

卡尔森于 4 月份离开了该电视网，距离母公司福克斯公司(FOXA.O)与 Dominion Voting Systems 达成价值 7.875 亿美元的诽谤诉讼达成和解，不到一周，卡尔森在该诉讼中扮演了主角。

据福克斯新闻报道，沃特斯将从 7 月 17 日开始，将其观点节目“杰西·沃特斯黄金时段”移至晚上 8 点播出，该节目于去年推出，为晚上 7 点节目。

福克斯补充说，沃特斯的节目今年拥有超过 260 万观众，其中 27 万来自 25-54 岁这一关键年龄段，是有线电视新闻历史上晚上 7 点类别中收视率最高的。

卡尔森的脱口秀节目《塔克·卡尔森今夜》是收视率最高的美国有线电视新闻网络上同一人群中收视率最高的有线电视新闻节目。

沃特斯于 2002 年加入该网络，担任制作助理，并在 2017 年开始的周末节目《沃特斯世界》中采访了前总统唐纳德·特朗普和企业家马克·库班。

卡尔森离开后的几周内，福克斯用“福克斯新闻今夜”节目填补了晚上 8 点的空档，该节目由一批福克斯新闻名人轮流主持。

据福克斯新闻报道，劳拉·英格拉汉姆 (Laura Ingraham) 将于晚上 7 点提前观看节目，深夜主持人格雷格·古特菲尔德 (Greg Gutfeld) 则提前一个小时到晚上 10 点。

与此同时，该媒体表示，肖恩·汉尼提 (Sean Hannity) 将继续参加晚上 9 点的演出。

Akriti Sharma 和 Akash Sriram 在班加罗尔的报道；编辑：阿尼尔·德席尔瓦; Mon, 26 Jun 2023 16:26:11 GMT https://www.reuters.com/business/media-telecom/fox-news-says-jesse-watters-replace-tucker-carlson-anchor-8-pm-show-2023-06-26/ https://www.reuters.com/business/media-telecom/fox-news-says-jesse-watters-replace-tucker-carlson-anchor-8-pm-show-2023-06-26/Reuters狐狸福克斯新闻/阵容（更新 3，PIX） Mitsotakis sworn in as Greek PM, promises more jobs and 'big changes'Summary:
  • 米佐塔基斯在议会获得 158 个席位，左翼激进联盟党获得 48 个席位
  • 希腊总理将于格林尼治标准时间 1400 宣布组阁
  • 任命新民主党副总统为财政部长

基里亚科斯·米佐塔基斯周一在选举中大获全胜，宣誓就任总理，承诺重建希腊信用评级、创造就业机会、提高工资和增加国家收入。

他的中右翼新民主党在周日的重复选举中在300个席位的议会中获得了158个席位，远远领先于左翼激进左翼联盟(Syriza)，该党在2015年至2019年长达十年的经济危机最严重的时期统治希腊。

“我承诺，在第二个任期内，我们将实现国家急需的重大变革，”米佐塔基斯在收到组建政府的正式授权后告诉总统卡特琳娜·萨克拉罗普卢。

这位 55 岁的前银行家、强大政治家族的后裔从 2019 年起担任总理，直到 5 月 21 日投票结果未定后辞职，转而支持看守总理。

他承诺在债务危机后推进改革，重建信用评级，增加重要旅游业的收入，并将工资提高到接近欧盟平均水平。

评级机构穆迪高级副总裁斯特芬·戴克表示，新民主党的胜利对信用有利。米佐塔基斯的第二个四年任期“将确保财政和经济政策的连续性。特别是继续关注改善商业环境和银行业健康状况，”他说。

他预测希腊“将成为全球债务削减幅度最大的国家之一”，其总体政府债务负担从2022年底的171.3%下降到2025年占GDP的150%以下。

政府发言人于格林尼治标准时间 1400 点宣布了新内阁名单。

米佐塔基斯任命科斯蒂斯·哈齐达基斯为财政部长。

据政治分析人士称，58 岁的哈齐达基斯是一位说话温和的政治家和改革主义者，是新民主党的副总统。他在前政府中担任劳工和能源部长，负责监督希腊最大电力公司 PPC 的重组，该公司一直在债务危机遗留的逾期账单中苦苦挣扎。

上届政府外交部长尼科斯·登迪亚斯被任命为国防部长。外交部长由乔治·杰拉佩特里蒂斯 (George Gerapetritis) 担任，他是米佐塔基斯 (Mitsotakis) 的高级助手，米佐塔基斯 (Mitsotakis) 曾任国务部长，并在 2 月份发生致命火车事故后接管了交通部。

内阁将于周二宣誓就职。

尽管 COVID-19 大流行和铁路事故暴露了卫生和公共交通系统的缺陷，但价格飙升和经济困难最近成为选民最关心的问题。

周日的投票中，亚历克西斯·齐普拉斯 (Alexis Tsipras) 领导的激进左翼联盟 (Syriza) 惨败，该党失去了 30 多名议员。希腊报纸《Ta Nea》在头版写道：“米佐塔基斯占据绝对统治地位，没有对手。”

齐普拉斯表示，激进左翼联盟将努力东山再起，他的政党将决定他自己的未来。

这次投票还让包括反移民“斯巴达”在内的三个边缘右翼和民族主义政党进入议会，总共获得 34 个席位。

Renee Maltezou 和 Angeliki Koutantou 的补充报道；编辑：Lincoln Feast、Andrew Heavens 和 Christina Fincher ; Mon, 26 Jun 2023 15:19:55 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/mitsotakis-be-sworn-greek-pm-after-landslide-victory-2023-06-26/ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/mitsotakis-be-sworn-greek-pm-after-landslide-victory-2023-06-26/Lefteris Papadimas, Karolina Tagaris希腊选举/（更新 3、PIX、电视） Analysis: Mutiny lays bare prospect for Putin of 'forever war' in UkraineSummary:
  • 兵变暴露俄罗斯后备力量薄弱
  • 起义可能不会让基辅突然取得突破
  • 骚乱可能会打击俄罗斯军队的士气
  • 问题层出不穷，基辅因俄罗斯“混乱”而欢欣鼓舞

俄罗斯的一场流产叛变表明，克里姆林宫面临着乌克兰长期、残酷冲突的风险，尽管它并没有让基辅在战场上立即取得突破。

俄罗斯雇佣军头目叶夫根尼·普里戈任的瓦格纳部队在周五的叛变后返回基地，许多问题仍然存在。根据白俄罗斯总统斡旋的协议，叛变第二天被取消。

但基辅现任和前任官员表示，这次兵变让人们惊讶地看到了俄罗斯政治体系所面临的压力。报告显示，俄罗斯后备部队非常薄弱，难以应对威胁。

2019 年至 2020 年担任乌克兰国防部长的安德烈·扎戈罗德纽克 (Andriy Zagorodniuk) 对路透社表示：“我认为，显然，由于战争无休无止地持续下去，他们并不安全。”

“还记得媒体上的‘永远战争’的概念吗？我认为他们将不得不重新考虑这一点。”

一场持续数月甚至数年的战争将不可避免地意味着双方都会有更多的伤亡。

自普京于 2022 年 2 月派遣军队进入乌克兰进行他所谓的“特别军事行动”以来，西方官员称已造成数万人死亡。

扎戈罗德纽克说，普里戈任的瓦格纳雇佣军从俄罗斯南部向莫斯科狂奔数百公里，几乎没有遇到任何抵抗，这显然是令人震惊的。

“他们开始集中资源来阻止他们。我们看到了这些资源，但数量并不多……本质上，除了他们现在在前线的力量外，他们已经没有多少力量了，”他说。

不愿透露姓名的美国官员对路透社表示，还有很多事情尚不清楚，包括为什么俄罗斯军队没有采取更多措施阻止瓦格纳的前进。

克里姆林宫在指责普里戈任领导叛乱的第二天表示，将允许他前往白俄罗斯而不会面临指控，以换取停止其部队冲向莫斯科的回报。

目前尚不清楚该交易的更多细节。

普里戈任曾与普京私下关系密切，其战士在俄罗斯东部的攻势中发挥了重要作用，几周来他多次对俄罗斯国防部长谢尔盖·绍伊古和军方高层进行了激烈的口头攻击。他甚至质疑战争的理由。

乌克兰外交部长德米特罗·库莱巴表示：“敌后的任何混乱都符合我们的利益。”

但基辅官员警告说，即使没有精锐的瓦格纳战斗机，俄罗斯仍然在乌克兰境内拥有一支庞大的军队，并且能够招募更多士兵。

乌克兰总统官员米哈伊洛·波多利亚克(Mykhailo Podolyak)告诉路透社，骚乱将打击俄罗斯军队的士气。

“俄罗斯士兵的士气进一步低落，俄罗斯将军们受到明显的羞辱，他们的疑虑增加，这将在一定程度上恶化防御质量。”

没有让步

俄罗斯的动乱来袭，莫斯科长达16个月的入侵还没有结束的迹象，双方都不愿做出让步。

西方支持的乌克兰正处于长期宣传的反攻的早期阶段，以夺回其南部和东部被占领的土地。它表示，其主要进攻力量尚未到来，大部分部队尚未投入战斗。

经过几周的行动，基辅已经重新夺回了一系列村庄，尽管总统泽连斯基承认进展“比预期慢”。

一位中欧高级外交官表示，他们认为普里戈任流产的叛变“不会立即对战争产生影响”。

但这位外交官警告说，周末事件的许多问题仍未得到解答，因此现在谈论长期影响还为时过早。

乌克兰军方国家抵抗中心表示，俄罗斯周六已将第76空降突击师的两个连从前线空运到莫斯科，并计划将他们留在那里至少一周。

声明称：“应该指出的是，没有大量敌军转移的事实，我们谈论的是单个部队。”

乌克兰没有报告称俄罗斯军队在战场上的姿态没有其他变化，莫斯科军队有几个月的时间通过挖掘数千条战壕和布设雷区来准备乌克兰的反击。

英国国防部周日表示，基辅军队最近几天已重新调整，并在南部和东部的三个主轴线进行重大进攻行动。

乌克兰对来自前线的信息严格保密。

乌克兰一名高级国防官员周六表示，基辅军队袭击了东部多个地区，取得了一些进展，但她没有透露更多细节。她说，南部地区正在发生激烈的战斗。

“俄罗斯人哪儿也不去”

泽连斯基在战时新闻发布会上表达了对普京的蔑视，他嘲笑俄罗斯的“混乱”，称这应该促使俄罗斯军队返回家园照顾自己的国家。

随着骚乱的展开，泽连斯基表示普京看起来“非常害怕”，并暗示他可能正在躲藏起来。

“今天，世界可以看到俄罗斯的主人控制不了任何东西。这没有任何意义。完全是一片混乱。缺乏任何可预测性，”他说。

瓦格纳的命运目前尚不清楚。该雇佣军组织已被证明是俄罗斯最有效的战斗力量之一，并在经历了战争中最长、最血腥的战斗后于四月份占领东部城市巴赫穆特的过程中发挥了重要作用。

克里姆林宫表示，瓦格纳的战士不会因叛变而受到起诉，以表彰他们之前为俄罗斯服务的经历，如果他们没有参加，他们可以与国防部签署合同。

扎戈罗德纽克表示，他相信俄罗斯可能会将该组织并入其军队内的现有部队，并且该组织将不复存在。

“这是相对好的消息。但仍然会有很多敌对行动，仍然会有战争：俄罗斯人不会去任何地方，”他说。

Pavel Polityuk 在基辅、Andrew Gray 在布鲁塞尔和 Phil Stewart 在华盛顿的补充报道，Angus MacSwan 编辑; Mon, 26 Jun 2023 14:48:25 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/mutiny-lays-bare-prospect-putin-forever-war-ukraine-2023-06-26/ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/mutiny-lays-bare-prospect-putin-forever-war-ukraine-2023-06-26/Tom Balmforth乌克兰危机/俄罗斯战场（分析、PIX） At least 3 dead, dozens of homes damaged after storms hit US Midwest, South

当局周一表示，周日龙卷风和雷暴袭击了美国中西部和南部，导致印第安纳州和阿肯色州数十栋房屋受损，至少三人死亡。

美国国家气象局表示，周日，印第安纳州中部和阿肯色州发生多场龙卷风和严重风暴。

印第安纳州马丁县的应急官员证实该地区有一人死亡。应急管理主任卡梅伦·沃尔夫表示，受害者受伤的伴侣已被空运到医院。他们住在一栋两层小木屋里，该木屋被暴风雨摧毁了。进一步的细节尚未立即公布。

沃尔夫在接受 PBS 采访时表示：“损害是随机的，而且是普遍存在的。”他说，损失主要发生在乡村，并补充说城镇没有受到风暴的严重打击。

据哥伦比亚广播公司新闻附属机构称，洛诺克县治安官办公室证实，由于周日的严重风暴，阿肯色州卡莱尔的一棵树倒塌砸中一栋房屋，造成两人死亡。

当地媒体的图像和镜头显示，倒下的树木堵塞了道路，房屋受损。官员称，印第安纳州和邻近州也出现了大冰雹。

据 NBC 新闻附属机构报道，印第安纳波利斯南部巴格斯维尔镇的消防队长埃里克·芬克豪瑟 (Eric Funkhouser) 表示，虽然当地没有人员伤亡的报告，但大约 75 所房屋在天气影响下遭受了中度至重度损坏。

印第安纳州中部为房屋受损和被毁的人们设立了紧急避难所。

根据停电跟踪网站 PowerOutage.us 的数据，截至周一上午，由于美国中西部和南部的天气原因，大约有 50 万公用事业客户面临停电。

一周前，密西西比州中部遭遇龙卷风袭击，造成至少一人死亡、约两打受伤。

最近，危险的热浪还在德克萨斯州和佛罗里达州催生了致命的龙卷风，本月在这两个州的狭长地带登陆的龙卷风造成至少四人死亡。洪水迫使近 150 人离开家园。

卡尼什卡·辛格 (Kanishka Singh) 华盛顿报道；编辑：埃德·奥斯蒙德、威廉·麦克林; Mon, 26 Jun 2023 14:47:01 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/us/least-one-dead-dozens-homes-damaging-after-storms-hit-us-midwest-south-2023-06-26/ https://www.reuters.com/world/us/least-one-dead-dozens-homes-damaging-after-storms-hit-us-midwest-south-2023-06-26/Kanishka Singh美国天气/（更新 1、PIX、电视） Russian officials emphasise unity after aborted mutinySummary:
  • 总理表示俄罗斯必须团结一致支持普京
  • 雇佣军对他采取行动后国防部长现身
  • 协议结束叛乱后没有普京或普里戈任的迹象
  • 莫斯科取消反恐措施，俄罗斯称“稳定”
  • 西方领导人表示，事件显示俄罗斯的外表出现裂痕

周一，俄罗斯高级官员聚集在总统弗拉基米尔·普京 (Vladimir Putin) 周围，而官方媒体称，当局仍在调查这位雇佣军领导人，他周末的叛变似乎对这位俄罗斯领导人 23 年来的统治构成了重大威胁。

在强大的瓦格纳集团的战士占领军事总部并向莫斯科进军后的第一个工作日，官员们仍然没有透露有关突然结束叛乱的协议的细节。

被任命为总理的普京内阁领导者米哈伊尔·米舒斯京承认，俄罗斯面临“稳定的挑战”，并呼吁公众忠诚。

他在电视转播的政府会议上表示：“我们需要作为一个团队共同行动，保持所有力量的团结，团结在总统周围。”

普京本人没有透露有关此次叛乱的任何消息，他周六表示，这次叛乱使俄罗斯的生存受到威胁，并誓言要惩罚叛乱背后的人。克里姆林宫发布了他向工业论坛参与者表示祝贺的视频，但没有说明该视频的拍摄时间。

当局发布了国防部长谢尔盖·绍伊古的视频，这显然是为了传达常态。叛变者要求解雇他，导致人们猜测他的免职可能是结束叛乱安排的一部分。

瓦格纳的老板、叛变领袖叶夫根尼·普里戈任 (Yevgeny Prigozhin) 仍然没有公开露面，他最后一次出现是在周六，当时他正离开顿河畔罗斯托夫 (Rostov-On-Don)，他的部下在他命令他们站立之前占领了这座南部城市。向下。

Berlin is ready to station a 4,000-strong army brigade in Lithuania permanently in coordination with NATO defence planning following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the German defence minister said on Monday.

"Germany stands by its commitment as a NATO member, as Europe's biggest economy, to stand up for the protection of the eastern flank," Boris Pistorius said during a visit to Vilnius on Monday, without giving a timeline.

He said however that the necessary infrastructure must be in place as a precondition. In the past, Berlin said it would take Lithuania years to provide barracks, housing areas for families, depots and training grounds.

"We agree that the brigade will grow step-by-step as the infrastructure is established," Pistorius said, adding that such a deployment could not be completed within "a few months".

The deployment must also be compatible with NATO's regional plans detailing how it would respond to a Russian attack, the minister stressed.

Lithuania's President Gitanas Nauseda said he was aiming for the infrastructure to be in place by 2026.

"We are simplifying the procedures...in order to be able to finalize the building of infrastructure by 2026," he said. "But I will not be angry if the minister of defence will finalize in 2025."

Germany already leads NATO's multi-national battlegroup in Lithuania, a reinforced battalion of some 1,000 troops.

Beyond this, a German brigade is on stand-by in Germany to rapidly reinforce troops in Lithuania if needed. Vilnius, however, has long demanded the permanent presence of a full German brigade.

Pistorius and NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg travelled to Lithuania to attend an exercise that will test the swift reinforcing of the existing German-led NATO battlegroup to the size of a brigade, a scenario to be enacted in case of heightened tensions or a conflict with Russia.

Stoltenberg welcomed Germany's announcement but rejected calls for an immediate bolstering of troops along the alliance's eastern flank in response to the mutiny in Russia.

"It's not all about presence, it's all about the ability to have early warnings and indications, and then react quickly if there is a need - and this exercise demonstrates exactly that," he said.

NATO leaders will meet for a summit in Vilnius On July 11-12.

The aborted mutiny by Russia's Wagner mercenary group at the weekend demonstrates the weakness of the Russian leadership and the scale of the Kremlin's strategic mistake in waging war on Ukraine, NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said on Monday.

Russia sought to restore calm on Monday after Wagner fighters halted a rapid advance on Moscow, withdrew from the seized southern Russian city of Rostov and headed back to their bases late on Saturday under a deal that guaranteed their safety.

Their commander, Yevgeny Prigozhin , was to move to Belarus under the deal mediated by Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko, the Kremlin said.

"The events over the weekend are an internal Russian matter, and yet another demonstration of the big strategic mistake that President (Vladimir) Putin made with his illegal annexation of Crimea and the war against Ukraine," Stoltenberg told reporters on a visit to Lithuania.

"Of course, it is a demonstration of weakness," he added. "It demonstrates the fragility the Russian regime but it is not for NATO to intervene in those issues, that's a Russian matter."

Confusion over the weekend's extraordinary events has left Western governments groping for answers to what could happen next in the country with the world's largest nuclear arsenal - and to its war on Ukraine.

Mikhail Mishustin, who leads Putin's cabinet as his appointed prime minister, acknowledged on Monday that Russia had faced "a challenge to its stability", and called for public loyalty.

Stoltenberg said NATO was monitoring the situation in Belarus and, again, condemned Moscow's announcement to deploy nuclear weapons there.

"We don't see any indication that Russia is preparing to use nuclear weapons but NATO remains vigilant," he said, adding NATO's deterrence was strong enough to keep its people safe in a "more dangerous world".

At the same time, Stoltenberg assured Kyiv of NATO's continued support.

"If Russia thinks it can intimidate us from supporting Ukraine, it will fail," he said. "We stand with Ukraine for as long as it takes."

Stoltenberg was in Lithuania to attend an exercise that will test the swift reinforcing of the German-led NATO battlegroup in the country to the size of a brigade, a military unit comprising up to 5,000 troops, a scenario to be enacted in case of heightened tensions or a conflict with Russia.

He described the drills as a clear message that NATO was ready to defend every inch of allied territory.

Reporting by Sabine Siebold and Bart Meijer; Editing by Alison Williams, Conor Humphries and Alex Richardson ; Mon, 26 Jun 2023 13:11:31 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/wagner-mutiny-shows-moscows-big-strategic-mistake-attacking-kyiv-nato-2023-06-26/ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/wagner-mutiny-shows-moscows-big-strategic-mistake-attacking-kyiv-nato-2023-06-26/Reuters乌克兰CRISIS/NATO (UPDATE 2, TV, PIX) Special Report: US, Swedish prosecutors study graft complaint naming son of Turkey's Erdogan

Anti-corruption authorities in the United States and Sweden are reviewing a complaint alleging that the Swedish affiliate of a US company pledged to pay tens of millions of dollars in kickbacks if a son of Turkey's President Recep Tayyip Erdogan helped it secure a dominant market position in the country.

The proposed plan was detailed in communications and business documents seen by Reuters, as well as by a person familiar with the matter. Reuters is reporting this plan and the resulting preliminary probes for the first time.

Ultimately, no kickbacks were paid, according to the complaint submitted to authorities by an individual and reviewed by Reuters. In fact, Dignita Systems AB, the Swedish company, abruptly abandoned the project late last year, according to two people familiar with the matter and company communications seen by Reuters.

Dignita's US owner confirmed to Reuters that the project was dropped, saying it had learned of "potentially concerning conduct" in Turkey and terminated several people involved.

The company's plan, according to the complaint, was for the administration of President Erdogan to pass regulations that would boost sales of Dignita's product: dashboard breathalyzers that lock a vehicle's ignition when the driver is inebriated.

In return for 10 years of commercial exclusivity selling its products, Dignita committed it would pay tens of millions of dollars in lobbying fees, via a shell company, to two institutions for which Bilal Erdogan is a board member, the complaint says.

Although the effort was scuttled in September, it provides rare insight into how an investor regarded Bilal Erdogan as a key person to gain access to President Erdogan, who won a new five-year mandate on May 28.

Dignita's chief executive officer, Anders Eriksson, told Reuters he could not discuss the alleged scheme because he was about to leave the company and bound by a confidentiality agreement.

Through a lawyer, Bilal Erdogan said allegations that he colluded with Dignita "are completely incorrect."律师补充说，这是一张“谎言网”。 A senior official with the Turkish presidency's communications directorate declined to comment for this article.

Reuters was unable to confirm independently whether President Erdogan and his son Bilal were aware of, or had involvement in Dignita's alleged kickback scheme.

After receiving the complaint in April, the US Department of Justice and Swedish prosecutors tasked a special agent and a detective inspector, respectively, to conduct preliminary probes and determine if any provisions of American and Swedish anti-bribery laws may have been violated, according to official responses seen by Reuters. The preliminary probes may not lead to formal investigations or charges.

In both countries, a pledge to pay commissions may constitute a criminal offense under certain circumstances, US and Swedish anti-corruption experts said.华盛顿反腐败监督机构美国透明国际组织的律师斯科特·格雷塔克表示，在美国，即使没有资金易手，也可以认定违反《反海外腐败法》(FCPA)。 "But you would have to show that there was an agreement and that there was some sort of overt act, such as opening a bank account to provide a place for that money to go."

Spokespeople for the DOJ and Swedish prosecutors said they had no comment.

The United States may have jurisdiction to investigate Dignita's actions in Turkey under the FCPA because the Swedish company is owned by 1A Smart Start LLC, a Texas-based company that belongs to Apollo Global Management, one of the world's largest asset managers.

Apollo referred questions about its alleged role to Smart Start, which said that it has never sold products or generated any revenue in Turkey.

"Upon learning of potentially concerning conduct regarding future business opportunities in Turkey, we promptly investigated and took corrective action, including terminating the sole employee and the third-party consultants involved," the company said in a statement to Reuters. "As a result, we have not moved forward with doing business in Turkey."

Smart Start retains an affiliate registered in Turkey, according to Turkish corporate records.

News of Sweden's preliminary probe into Dignita's Turkish endeavor comes at a sensitive moment in bilateral relations between Ankara and Stockholm. Turkey has blocked Sweden from joining the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), accusing the Nordic country of providing refuge to alleged terrorists, an accusation Swedish authorities have rejected.

TWO-PRONGED STRATEGY

The Swedish company's plan hinged on convincing Turkish authorities to render the use of its breathalyzers and ignition locks mandatory for certain categories of drivers and vehicles, and then obtaining 10-year exclusivity for their supply, according to an eight-slide presentation prepared for President Erdogan in summer 2022, and seen by Reuters.

After four years of frustrating efforts, Dignita was able to address a letter to the Turkish leader outlining its plan, according to the business documents, which include a copy of the June 2022 message.

That opportunity arose about four months after a representative of Dignita allegedly met with Bilal Erdogan in Istanbul in February last year to review a two-pronged strategy, according to one of the people familiar with the matter.

Under the first part of the strategy, laid out in detail in an 11-page "marketing exploration agreement" seen by Reuters, a Turkish affiliate of Smart Start committed to pay regular consultancy fees to an Istanbul-based shell company controlled by a person handpicked by the Swedish and US firms.

The consultancy fees to be paid to the shell company ranged from 50 cents to $3 dollars per device and per month, depending on the number of vehicles equipped with Dignita's kits. On that basis, and over the envisioned 10-year exclusivity period, the total fee funneled to the shell company would amount to $54 million for 500,000 vehicles, and snowball to $384 million for two million, the agreement, dated March 2022, and Dignita correspondence show.

The second part of the strategy, discussed only verbally according to the person familiar with the matter, called for the shell company to make hefty donations to two institutions where Bilal Erdogan serves as board member, the Ibn Haldun University and the Tugva youth foundation.

Ibn Haldun University was founded by Turgev, a charity organization President Erdogan helped create in the 1990s, when he was mayor of Istanbul.与此同时，Tugva 已注册为非营利组织，有权为社会福利项目募集捐款。 It operates student dormitories in more than two dozen Turkish cities.

The two foundations have expanded into large social-welfare operations underpinning what opposition leaders have described as a nationwide patronage system used by President Erdogan to look after his voters.

The senior official with the Turkish presidency's communications directorate declined to comment on the patronage accusations expressed by political opponents.图尔格夫的一位发言人表示，该基金会与 Dignita 没有任何关系，并补充说，有关该慈善机构不正常活动的指控毫无根据。该发言人表示：“为了确保我们活动的透明度，我们的行政和财务流程会定期由独立审计师进行评估。” Directors at the Ibn Haldun University and Tugva didn't respond to messages seeking comment.

Bilal Erdogan rarely appears in public. Alongside other members of the Erdogan family, the 42-year-old businessman owns minority interests in BMZ Group, a maritime transport and construction company.

His name has been associated with alleged corruption in the past. 2016年，意大利检察官对比拉尔·埃尔多安进行了洗钱调查，怀疑他在未申报的情况下将现金带入该国。他否认了这一指控，意大利检察官最终以缺乏证据为由放弃了调查。去年，俄罗斯政府声称有证据表明埃尔多安总统的儿子从与叙利亚伊斯兰国的跨境石油贸易中获利。俄罗斯拒绝分享其证据。 Bilal Erdogan denied the allegations, saying the radical insurgency was an enemy of Turkey.

Dignita set foot in Turkey in 2017 with the ambition of selling its traffic-safety devices. That year, Eriksson, the Dignita CEO, took the helm of the Turkish company set up by Smart Start, Turkish corporate records show.

For several years, Dignita and Smart Start made little headway because they couldn't get access, even indirectly, to President Erdogan, the person familiar with the matter said.

A breakthrough came in early 2021 when an Eriksson aide was able to present the Swedish company's plan to a Turkish professor of theology turned politician, Irfan Gunduz, according to the person familiar with the matter.该人士表示，Dignita 选择与这位政治家接触是因为众所周知，他与比拉尔·埃尔多安关系密切，而埃尔多安反过来又可以提供与土耳其总统的接触。冈杜兹 (Gunduz) 担任伊本·哈尔顿大学 (Ibn Haldun University) 董事会主席； Bilal Erdogan is deputy chairman.

Reached on May 30 in the United States, where he said he was on a business trip, Gunduz told Reuters that it was "all gossip," adding that "neither I nor Bilal ever heard about this company; ever met with this company."

"I CAN'T IMAGINE"

Suddenly, after the alleged meeting with Gunduz, doors began opening and Dignita was able to discuss with a senior member of President Erdogan's administration how they would amend traffic-safety regulations to cover the use of breathalyzers and ignition locks, according to company correspondence and the person familiar with the matter.

Some countries require public transport operators as well as convicted drunk drivers to equip their vehicles with ignition locking systems. Before turning on the engine, a driver must blow into a mouthpiece: if the breath-alcohol concentration is greater than the legally permitted limit, the device prevents the engine from starting.

In spring 2021, Dignita understood that Gunduz was seeking an upfront lobbying fee, potentially as high as $100 million, according to the person familiar with the matter. "Let's discuss," Eriksson, the Dignita CEO, said in a June 8 message to his aide for Turkey.

In their correspondence, reviewed by Reuters, Eriksson and his aide initially mentioned Gunduz and Bilal Erdogan by name – or as "the son" in the case of Bilal – especially when discussing meeting schedules, but later took the precautionary step of designating the Turkish side as "the Lobby," according to the person familiar with the matter.

"If the Lobby gets 100 million for this they will be extremely happy," Eriksson said in one message. "I can't imagine they have close to this kind of money or that they will ever have the opportunity to make 100 million again so easily."

Reuters was unable to confirm independently whether Gunduz requested payment of a lobbying fee.

In ensuing messages to his aide, Eriksson sought to clarify what services such a fee would buy. “我们希望游说集团能够长期支持我们，并‘保护’我们免受竞争，”他在同一天的另一条消息中写道。 If competition was allowed in, he said, fees would be halved.

Eriksson also made clear that Dignita wouldn't pay any lobbying fees until it began earning money in Turkey. "If they don't agree, we better stop because we will never be allowed by our owners to pay them before we get paid," the CEO said in a June 14 message.

By early 2022, the Swedish and Turkish sides had abandoned the idea of an upfront payment and shifted to the alleged two-pronged strategy calling for ongoing lobbying fees to be disbursed via a shell company, according to the person familiar with the matter. And after the alleged encounter with Bilal Erdogan – it took place on February 25 last year inside a children's music school located on the Asian side of Istanbul, the person familiar with the matter said – Dignita understood that it should send a formal letter to President Erdogan outlining its business pitch, company correspondence shows.

In summer 2022, Eriksson received a draft of the letter and some instructions from Smart Start's CEO, Matthew Strausz, company correspondence shows. “安德斯，”这位美国首席执行官在 6 月 23 日的一条消息中告诉他的瑞典同事。 "See attached. This, other than how we will address the President, is the draft that we will use. It has been cleared by counsel. Can you have translated and sent back for final sign off? Apollo has a (...) lawyer that will give final review, then we will furnish for you to send personally."

Strausz referred questions to a spokesperson for Smart Start, who didn't address the CEO's role in the company's response to questions from Reuters.

The final version of the letter seen by Reuters is dated June 29 and signed with blue ink by the Dignita CEO.在这封三页的信中，埃里克森首先赞扬了埃尔多安总统在改善土耳其道路安全方面取得的成就，并表示他的公司愿意帮助他走得更远。 If ignition locks were made mandatory for drunk-driving offenders and public transport vehicles, such as school buses, and if Dignita was awarded a contract, the CEO said, the company stood ready to discuss "the underlying guarantees and conditions that would be required to enable our investment."

The letter was sent to Gunduz, the politician, and delivered to the presidency in mid-July, according to the person familiar with the matter.

Although Dignita could not ascertain whether President Erdogan saw the letter, it had an immediate and positive impact, the person said. That same month, the Swedish company learned from Gunduz that meetings with a senior member of President Erdogan's administration, and possibly with the president himself, would take place soon to discuss the next steps, according to company communications.

Later in July, the planned shell company was founded in Istanbul, according to Turkish business records.法律文件显示，其目的之一是充当国内外公司之间的调解人。 And in August, Dignita prepared the eight-slide document for President Erdogan.

By then, however, according to the other person familiar with the matter, Dignita's owners in the US, Smart Start and Apollo, had grown concerned about the Turkish project's untoward facets, including that it could violate US anti-bribery laws. After an in-house review, a decision was made to stop it, the person said.

In September, Dignita informed a participant in the talks on the Turkish side that the Swedish company had dropped the project, without giving a reason, a message seen by Reuters shows.

"Let's hope for the best," the participant responded.

Ukraine said on Monday its forces had regained control of the southeastern village of Rivnopil as they continue to advance against Russian forces after launching a counteroffensive.

The village appeared to be the ninth recaptured by Ukraine this month in the early stages of an offensive in which Ukrainian officials have signalled that the main push is yet to come.

"(Ukrainian) Defence forces have brought Rivnopil back under our control," Deputy Defence Minister Hanna Maliar wrote on the Telegram messaging app.

She did not say when Ukrainian forces had recaptured Rivnopil, which lies just to the west of a cluster of villages that Kyiv says it recaptured earlier in the counteroffensive .

An unverified 13-second video posted on Telegram by Ukrainian land forces, showing a group of Ukrainian soldiers in front of the remains of a building with a Ukrainian flag flying from a post, indicated the village was retaken on Sunday.

"Today on June 25, 2023, the fighters of the Second Battalion of the 31st Mechanised Brigade liberated the village of Rivnopil," one of the soldiers in the video said.

Using a derogatory term for Russian soldiers, he said: "The orcs are fleeing, we are moving ahead."

Maliar said in an earlier statement that Ukrainian forces had liberated about 130 square km (50 square miles) in the south since the counterattack began.

"There are already liberated territories and our advance continues," Oleksandr Tarnavskyi, commander of Ukrainian forces on the "Tavria", or southern, front, said on Telegram.

He said on Saturday Kyiv had also taken back land near Krasnohorivka in the Donetsk region that had been occupied since 2014, when fighting broke out with Russian-backed breakaway groups in eastern Ukraine, but gave no other details.

Russia, which launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, still holds swathes of territory in the east and south. It did not immediately comment on events in Rivnopil, and Reuters was unable to verify the situation on the battlefield.
